title: Strategic Partnership with IHC in Food Production & Distribution
description: IHC's recent acquisition of 14.83% in Grupo Nutresa and consolidation of assets in dairy (Marmum Dairy Farm, Al Ain Farms) shows strong commitment to expanding agri-food operations across LATAM and MENA. They are looking to create value through expansion and acquisition in the food sector.
example: A European or Asian food production company could partner with IHC or Grupo Nutresa to introduce new products into the LATAM or GCC markets, utilize IHC's established production and distribution network, and/or collaborate on building new processing plants in emerging markets. For example, an Asian seafood exporter might leverage IHC's logistics and Grupo Nutresa’s distribution channels to enter Latin American retail and foodservice markets.
roadmap: Identify the relevant IHC subsidiary (e.g., Grupo Nutresa, Ghitha Holding)
Propose a JV or co-manufacturing deal for product introduction or local processing in target markets
Align on distribution channels using Grupo Nutresa’s/ IHC’s logistics
Negotiate equity or profit-sharing structure
Launch pilot sales in one or two markets, adjust based on feedback
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: Supplying Advanced Solutions to IHC's Mining & Metals Operations
description: IHC (via International Resources Holding) has acquired 51% of Mopani Copper Mines, a major player in copper and cobalt mining. This creates a need for suppliers of mining equipment, environmental tech, digitalization, or even downstream processing partners.
example: An Australian mining technology company could offer digital mine optimization or environmental monitoring solutions to Mopani Copper Mines, enabling IHC to extract greater value and improve ESG credentials. Alternatively, an international commodity trading firm could establish a copper/cobalt offtake agreement to secure supply from Mopani.
roadmap: Establish contact with IHC/International Resources Holding or Mopani Copper Mines' procurement/interests team
Present technology/service offering or offtake proposal
Coordinate technical evaluation or pilot project
Commercial negotiation and contract finalization
Initiate delivery, support, and implement improvements
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: Blockchain & Crypto Mining Partnerships with 2PointZero and Citadel
description: IHC’s 2PointZero, after acquiring Was Four, has expanded into blockchain with a 49% stake in Citadel, the Middle East leader in crypto mining. This positions IHC as a partner for blockchain infrastructure expansion and related technology projects.
example: A European renewable energy provider could partner with Citadel and IHC to provide sustainable energy solutions for crypto mining operations, or a blockchain software company could deploy new solutions on Citadel’s mining infrastructure.
roadmap: Reach out to 2PointZero and Citadel teams to discuss partnership opportunities
Define collaboration scope (energy, tech, joint operations, etc.)
Negotiate commercial and technical terms
Integrate solutions and launch partnership
Monitor KPIs and expand collaboration
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: Expansion in UAE Real Estate Market via Modon Holding Platform
description: Modon Holding, now combined with multiple real estate entities and ADNEC, has created one of the UAE's largest real estate platforms. This is ripe for partnerships on mixed-use development, digital solutions, hospitality brands, or smart city technology integration.
example: A global hospitality brand could co-develop a hotel or serviced residences on Modon land. A PropTech firm could partner to pilot smart building solutions across Modon’s properties. Asian institutional investors may invest in Modon Holding real estate funds targeting UAE growth.
roadmap: Contact Modon Holding/IHC business development team
Present partnership proposal (development, tech, services, investment)
Negotiate terms and identify suitable assets/projects
Sign agreements and launch project(s)
Scale or replicate successful models across portfolio
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: Corporate Governance Technology Collaboration
description: IHC has pioneered integrating an AI-powered virtual entity, Aiden Insight, as a board observer. This is a signal to AI/LegalTech firms to offer additional AI-driven governance or compliance solutions, or to embed similar tech in other conglomerates.
example: A LegalTech AI company could propose a pilot program for customized boardroom analytics or automated reporting using learnings from Aiden Insight at IHC, potentially in partnership with local UAE holding companies or conglomerates.
roadmap: Initiate conversation with IHC governance/innovation teams
Demonstrate AI-driven solution’s capabilities
Launch proof-of-concept or pilot in specific board or compliance processes
Evaluate impact and scalability
Roll out to other IHC subsidiaries or across new markets
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: DOOH Advertising, Media, and Marketing Partnerships with Backlite Media
description: Multiply Group (within IHC) acquired 100% of Backlite Media, a leading Digital Out-of-Home (DOOH) media company. Global brands and AdTech companies can partner to leverage premium advertising inventory across GCC.
example: A global automaker or consumer electronics brand could sign a regional DOOH campaign using Backlite Media’s assets, or an AdTech firm could integrate programmatic buying capabilities into Backlite’s network.
roadmap: Approach Multiply Group/Backlite Media business development
Design advertising campaign or pitch technology integration
Finalize pricing and technical onboarding
Launch campaign or roll out solution
Monitor ROI, iterate, and expand partnership
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024

title: Joint Ventures and Procurement Opportunities in Oilfield Technology
description: Enersol, a JV between Alpha Dhabi Holding (IHC subsidiary) and ADNOC Drilling, expanded its shareholding in US-based Gordon Technologies, becoming majority owner. This creates opportunities for upstream oil & gas tech suppliers, IoT firms, or US-EU export partnerships.
example: A European IoT oilfield service company could partner with Gordon Technologies and Enersol to co-develop advanced drilling data systems or pilot new downhole sensors for GCC and US shale markets.
roadmap: Engage with Enersol/Alpha Dhabi/Gordon Technologies’ R&D or business team
Identify areas of complementary technology/service
Agree JV or supplier contract terms
Deploy pilot project/field trial
Review results and agree on commercial rollout
source_name: IHC reports impressive 46% revenue growth to AED41.7 billion and 18% net profit jump to AED12.3 billion in H1 2024
